Course Description: This is an advanced course on Computer Vision offered to undergraduate and graduate students. The goal is to develop an understanding of a few selected topics in computer vision and enable students to understand and develop applications using existing tools. Students will be given theoretical and programming assignments targeted towards solving real-world computer vision problems.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Apply different techniques of feature extraction and image/video segmentation.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Apply different techniques of action/emotion recognition.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Apply ideas from multi-view geometry in ap
Course Outcomes.CO4: Look up relevant literature and identify potential solutions for a given computer vision problem and
Course Outcomes.CO5: Evaluate and compare quantitative performance of vision

Resource Material.Reference Book: David Forsyth, Jean Ponce, "Computer Vision: A Modern Approach", Pearson Education, second edition.
